intro: Byrsonima bumeliifolia f. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved bitter apple, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically bitter and used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its genus.
